abstracts.cdata!:
The Project would support the
            Government's efforts to diversify Zambia's energy
            consumption away from high cost petroleum fuels by
            determining the technical and economic viability of
            rehabilitating the Maamba coal mining operation in Southern
            Zambia. The Project would consist of the following
            components: (i) technical and economic feasibility study for
            reorganizing and rehabilitating the Maamba mining complex,
            including an examination of coal pricing and marketing and a
            review of Maamba Collieries' technical and managerial
            constraints and personnel training needs; (ii) procurement
            of critical spare parts and components needed to keep the
            mining complex operating during the study period and quality
            control equipment for the coal preparation plant; and (iii)
            training of key technical personnel for the implementation
            of the repair and maintenance program.
